reviewText: Too simple.  Just repeated characters.  There is more english then gujarati in the videos.

Pros: This is cute and keeps my 2-year-old's attention. He loves watching the animals and even repeats the words which are repeated. The main dialogues are in English, and when things are shown, both the English and Gujarati words are presented. The Gujarati is spoken by an adult's voice, and the Gujarati is spoken by a child, and there is enough repetition to help with memorization. The songs are catchy enough that my child sings them to himself while playing.

Only cons are: I wish it was longer. The vocabulary is pretty limited. The word for all the animals is given only in English (lion, elephant, etc) when introducing the characters. The songs are in English with only some words changed to Gujarati. The colors shown are not quite right... "purple" looks like pink, the rainbow colors are out of order, and instead of bhuro for blue, it has something else. The Gujarati is transliterated in English characters, so distinction between different Gujarati sounds is lost.

Overall I am happy with this since it's better than anything else out there, and we are getting a lot of use out of it.
My 2 year old granddaughter loves it. She doesn't know a word of Gujarati but now picking up words. Thanks.
I bought this for my two year old and he loved it.  I rarely let him watch tv unless its educational.  But, it was educational and entertaining.  He wanted to watch it over and over.
This is great but I wish the sound quality was better and no music AND BIGGER BOLD DARK LETTERS. Otherwise, it is great. I really like the english characters instead of hindi/guju.
I can see someone has already upload a trailer for Gujarati for Kids Numbers & Colours. So I would like to share this trailer for Gujarati for Kids Simple Words as my review A Fantastic set of DVDs.
